bonus.title: The Old Ways
bonus.effect: In the hands of a feral world character, any Low-Tech weapon loses the Primitive quality (if it had it) and gains the Proven (3) quality.

bonus.title: Omnissiah's Chosen
bonus.effect: A forge world character starts with either the Technical Knock or Weapon-Tech talent.

bonus.title: Breeding Counts
bonus.effect: Any time a highborn character would reduce his Influence (or his group's Profit Factor), he reduces it by 1 less (to a minimum reduction of 1)

bonus.title: Teeming Masses in Metal Mountains
bonus.effect: A hive world character ignores crowds for purposes of movement, treating them as open terrain. When in enclosed spaces, he also gains a +20 bonus to Navigate (Surface) tests.

bonus.title: Faith in the Creed
bonus.effect: Whenever a shrine world character spends a Fate point, he rolls 1d10. On a result of 1, the character's total number of Fate points is not reduced.

bonus.title: Child of the Dark
bonus.effect: A voidborn character starts with the Strong Minded talent, and gains a +30 bonus to tests for moving in a zero gravity environment.

bonus.title: Strength from the Land
bonus.effect: An agri-world character starts with the Brutal Charge (2) trait.

bonus.title: Touched by the Warp
bonus.effect: A Daemon world native begins with one Rank in the Psyniscience skill. Should he gain this skill again in a later step of character creation, he instead gains one additional Rank in the skill. Note that he cannot purchase more Ranks of this skill unless he acquires the Psyker aptitude. This character also begins with 1d10+5 Corruption points.

bonus.title: Survivor's Paranoia
bonus.effect: While a death world character is Surprised, non-Surprised attackers do not gain the normal +30 bonus to their Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill tests when targeting this character.

bonus.title: At Home in Armour
bonus.effect: A feudal world character ignores the maximum Agility value imposed by any armour he is wearing.

bonus.title: Rely on None but Yourself
bonus.effect: A frontier world character gains a +20 bonus to Tech-Use tests when applying personal weapon modifications, and a +10 bonus when repairing damaged items.

bonus.title: Serenity of the Green
bonus.effect: A garden world character halves the duration (rounded up) of any result from Shock or Mental Traumas Tables, and can remove Insanity points for 50xp per point rather than the normal 100xp.

bonus.title: Finger on the Pulse
bonus.effect: One survives a penal colony by instinctively knowing who is in charge and who is a threat. A penal colony character begins with one Rank in the Common Lore (Underworld) and Scrutiny skills, and starts with the Peer (Criminal Cartels) talent.

bonus.title: Secretive by Nature
bonus.effect: Those who manage to leave a quarantine world learn how to keep secrets. A quarantine world character starts with one Rank in the Deceive and Stealth skills.

bonus.title: Pursuit of Data
bonus.effect: Whenever a research station character reaches Rank 2 (Trained) in a Scholastic Lore skill, he also gains Rank 1 (Known) in one related or identical Forbidden Lore skill specialisation of his choice. The GM is the final arbiter of whether the two specialisations are related.
